channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Marni's sentimental guide to giving the past a presence in our homes
item.description: Over the years, I have earned the reputation as the stuff police. I am forever nagging you to purge, declutter, toss, donate, edit, dump, oust, clear, lighten up and let go. But today, sit down, I am going to sentimentally suggest that some old things you should keep.

item.title: Review: ‘Cabaret’ sings, dances and stings at Sarasota Players
item.description: As it approaches its 60th anniversary, John Kander and Fred Ebb’s 1966 musical “Cabaret” continues to be one of Broadway’s most malleable and impactful musicals, as evidenced by the new summer production running at the Sarasota Players through Aug. 9.

item.title: Toppmeyer: Warming up my SEC football 'underreactions' for Week 1
item.description: College footballseason is less than a month away, but some pundits already have hit midseason form. In a recent segment on ESPN, the assembled bobbleheads mused that LSU is putting too much emphasis on beatingClemsonin Week 1.

item.title: VOTE for Sarasota-Manatee's all-time best state championship football team
item.description: The Herald-Tribune has gone back and documented the area football teams that have won state championships.

item.title: YIMBY could help Sarasota County address affordable…
item.description: As Sarasota County policymakers and advocatessit down this fallto hash out bold approaches to the region's ongoing housing crisis, they’ll have a major new tool on the table – one that could help open hundreds of parcels of land owned by religious institutions.

item.title: What does the Big Beautiful Bill mean for your taxes…
item.description: On July 3, Congress passed a sweeping federal tax reform package called the “Big Beautiful Bill.” While the name has sparked memes, the content is serious: changes to tax brackets, small business incentives, Roth eligibility, and more.

item.title: USPS keeps losing my mail — and my trust
item.description: The recent article on how the U.S. Postal Service "continues delivering despite its challenges" deserves a response ("U.S. Postal Service marks 250 years," July 26).
